meanings.definition: The quality of being caustic or sarcastic in speech or manner.
meanings.sent1: Her causticities towards her classmates often hurt their feelings.
meanings.sent2: His causticities were evident in the way he spoke to his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: Despite his causticities, he always managed to make people laugh.
meanings.sent4: The causticities of her words left a lasting impact on those around her.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's causticities made the students think twice before speaking.

meanings.definition: The ability to burn or corrode organic tissue.
meanings.sent1: The causticities of the acid were dangerous to the skin.
meanings.sent2: Proper protection is necessary when handling substances with causticities.
meanings.sent3: The causticities of the cleaning solution made her eyes water.
meanings.sent4: The causticities of the chemical could eat through metal.
meanings.sent5: The causticities of the liquid were clearly marked on the warning label.

meanings.definition: The harshness or severity of a substance.
meanings.sent1: The causticities of the soap caused irritation to sensitive skin.
meanings.sent2: The causticities of the medicine made it difficult to swallow.
meanings.sent3: Despite the causticities of the weather, they enjoyed their outdoor picnic.
meanings.sent4: The causticities of the criticism stung more than expected.
meanings.sent5: The causticities of the vinegar gave the dish a strong flavor.
